titleStmt.title: The ruined lovers. Being a narrative of a young man that dyed for his cruel mistriss ... who not long after his death ... could not be comforted, but lingered out her dayes in melancholly, fell desperate sick, and so dyed. Tune of, Mock-beggers Hall stands empty.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, and J. Wright.,

notesStmt.note: Date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Right half-sheet contains: The second part, containing the misery, sorrow, and death of the maid. The same tune.
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
